verses.verse: ((1 David in the person of the people praiseth God for the victory, attributing it to God, and not to the strength of man. Wherein the holy Ghost directeth the faithful to Christ, who is the perfection of this kingdom.) ) The King shall rejoice in thy strength, O Lord: yea how greatly shall he rejoice in thy salvation?
Thou hast given him his heart’s desire, and hast not denied him the request of his lips. Selah.
For thou (Thou declarest thy liberal favor toward him before he prayed.) didst prevent him with liberal blessings, and didst set a crown of pure gold upon his head.
(David did not only obtain life, but also assurance that his posterity should reign forever.) He asked life of thee, and thou gavest him a long life forever and ever.
His glory is great in thy salvation: dignity and honor hast thou laid upon him.
For thou hast set him as (Thou hast made him thy blessings to others, and a perpetual example of thy favor forever.) blessings forever: thou hast made him glad with the joy of thy countenance.
Because the king trusteth in the Lord, and in the mercy of the most high, he shall not slide.
(Here he describeth the power of Christ’s kingdom against the enemies thereof.) Thine hand shall find out all thine enemies, and thy right hand shall find out them that hate thee.

Thou shalt make them like a fiery oven in time of thine anger: the Lord shall destroy them in his (This teacheth us patiently to endure the cross till God destroy the adversary.) wrath, and the fire shall devour them.
Their fruit shalt thou destroy from the earth, and their seed from the children of men.
For they (They laid as it were their nets to make God’s power to give place to their wicked enterprises.) intended evil against thee, and imagined mischief, but they shall not prevail.
Therefore shalt thou put them (As a mark to shoot at.) apart, and the strings of thy bow shalt thou make ready against their faces.
(Maintain thy Church against thine adversaries, that we may have ample occasion to praise thy Name.) Be thou exalted, O Lord, in thy strength: so will we sing and praise thy power.
